intro: Urvillea mexicana, commonly known as the Mexican urvillea, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its showy, pentagonal flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it produces woody capsules that contain numerous small seeds. Urvillea mexicana is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions.
